availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew J. Bickerstaff (Brandenburg, Kentucky, engineer and merchant)

body.p: Brandenburg, Kentucky, engineer and merchant. Ohio native. Son of Samuel Buckerstaff and Mary Bickerstaff. Married to Anna Bickerstaff. Father of Clay Bickerstaff and Mary Buckerstaff. Enginner in Steubenville, Ohio, in 1850. Steam engineer in Brandenburg in 1860. Retail liquor dealer in Brandenburg in 1863 and 1865.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Jefferson County, Steubenville, p. 67; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, Brandenburg, p. 4; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, Brandenburg, p. 3; U.S. IRS Tax Assessment Lists, 1862-1918, Ancestry, Kentucky, 1863, Collection District 3, Division 14, p. 73; U.S. IRS Tax Assessment Lists, 1862-1918, Ancestry, Kentucky, 1864, Collection District 3, Division 14; U.S. IRS Tax Assessment Lists, 1862-1918, Ancestry, Kentucky, 1865, Collection District 2, Division 17, p. 87.
